intro: Xyris asterocephala, commonly known as the star-headed yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the genus Xyris, which is part of the family Xyridaceae, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass family. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Xyris asterocephala typically grows in moist, sandy soils in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
